Create a Flex Prompt Template

For any use case that isn’t covered by the other template types, a flex prompt template type is your solution. Craft a flex prompt template that uses AI to generate content for your unique business cases.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions with the Einstein for Sales, Einstein for Platform, or Einstein for Service add-on


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create and manage prompt templates in Prompt Builder:	Prompt Template Manager permission set

To create a flex prompt template:

From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Prompt Builder, and then select Prompt Builder.
Click New Prompt Template.
In the Prompt Template Type dropdown, select Flex.
Specify your Prompt Template Name.
Define the resources that you want this prompt to use for generating content, as well as any fields or content types that you want Einstein to populate. For each Object, give a unique Name and API Name.
For example, to create a text message for a customer with an open case, select the Case object, and name it Customer Case.
To add another resource, click the Add Resources button at the bottom of the resources list. You can add up to 5 resources. To remove a resource, click the  button to the right of the Object.
Optionally, you can write a Description for your prompt template.
Click Next, and you’re redirected to the Prompt Template Workspace.
In the Prompt Template Workspace, create your prompt template, preview it, and see the LLM’s response.
In the Prompt Preview section, select an Object for each resource. Available options depend on which object you selected on the New Prompt Template page.
Click Save & Preview, and review the Response.
Add Record Merge Fields to a Flex Prompt Template
Save time with templates that use specific information from your Salesforce objects to create unique and detailed product descriptions, custom text messages, and more, at scale. Use merge fields in a flex template to have an LLM write content using up-to-the-minute data.
